benchmark_details.name: RareBench
benchmark_details.overview: RareBench is a pioneering benchmark designed to systematically evaluate the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) in diagnosing rare diseases along four critical dimensions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the diagnostic capabilities of LLMs in the context of rare diseases.
tasks: Comparison Analysis of Common and Rare Diseases
Differential Diagnosis among Universal Rare Diseases

data.source: The dataset is compiled from Peking Union Medical College Hospital (PUMCH) and publicly available datasets.
data.annotation: Cases were monitored by doctors to ensure patient information confidentiality and quality.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predictions made by LLMs in an evaluation context.
methodology.interpretation: A higher top-k recall indicates better diagnostic accuracy, while mean rank gives insight into the model's predictive rankings.
methodology.validation: The model was validated through comparison with clinical specialists and their diagnostic outcomes.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All patient data is monitored and anonymized to prevent personal information leakage.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study has been approved by the relevant ethical committees.
